properties.NAME: ST. COLUMBAN'S CEMETERY
properties.DESCRIPT: THIS CEMETERY HAS BEEN IN CONTINUOUS USE BY THE PARISH OF ST. COLUMBAN'S FOR WELL OVER A CENTURY.

properties.NAME: WOOD HOUSE MUSEUM
properties.DESCRIPT: IT'S AN OUTSTANDING LOCAL EXAMPLE OF CLASSICAL REVIVAL DETAILING APPLIED TO LOYALIST VERNACULAR FORM. IT WAS BUILT IN 1840 BY WILLIAM WOOD, A GENTLEMAN FARMER.

properties.NAME: CENTRAL PUBLIC SCHOOL
properties.DESCRIPT: THE RECOGNITION IS FOR THE SURVIVING STRUCTURAL ELEMENTS FROM THE 1931 ADDITION TO THE FRONT FAÇADE OF THE BUILDING WHICH COMPLEMENT ASPECTS OF THE 1883 DESIGN.

properties.NAME: CORNWALL STREET RAILWAY LOCOMOTIVE #17
properties.DESCRIPT: CORNWALL STREET RAILWAY LIGHT AND POWER COMPANY ENGINE 17 WAS BUILT IN AUGUST OF 1930 BY BALDWIN-WESTINGHOUSE IN PHILADELPHIA, PA AND PURCHASED BY THE COMPANY IN 1962. IT WAS USED TO MOVE FREIGHT CARS ALONG THE STREETS OF CORNWALL.

properties.NAME: CAPT. MACDONALD HOUSE
properties.DESCRIPT: BUILT BY CAPT. A. J. MACDONALD (1824-1913), AN EARLY SETTLER AND PROMINENT CORNWALL CITIZEN. THE PROPERTY IS AN EXAMPLE OF THE CHANGE IN LAND USE, FROM RURAL-AGRICULTURAL TO URBAN RESIDENTIAL.

properties.NAME: STORMONT COTTAGES
properties.DESCRIPT: THIS UNIQUE EXAMPLE OF INDUSTRIAL ROW HOUSING WAS BUILT IN 1882 USING LOCAL MATERIALS AND CRAFTSMEN. THE UNITS WERE RENTED TO EMPLOYEES OF THE STORMONT COTTON MILL.

properties.NAME: ST. COLUMBAN'S RECTORY
properties.DESCRIPT: ST. COLUMBAN'S RECTORY HAS BEEN IN CONTINUOUS USE AS SUCH SINCE IT WAS CONSTRUCTED IN 1874 UNDER THE SUPERVISION OF FATHER CHARLES B. MURRAY.

properties.NAME: FORMER CHESLEY'S INN
properties.DESCRIPT: OPERATED BY THE PROMINENT CHESLEY FAMILY AS A PIONEER INN, THIS STRUCTURE HAS SERVED AS A CENTRAL MEETING PLACE FOR THE COMMUNITY AND A WELCOME RESTING PLACE FOR WEARY TRAVELLERS.

properties.NAME: SD&G COURTHOUSE AND JAIL
properties.DESCRIPT: CONSTRUCTED IN 1834-35, THE BUILDING IS A FINE EXAMPLE OF PALLADIAN ARCHITECTURE, STYLE WIDELY USED IN THE 19TH CENTURY FOR INSTITUTIONAL BUILDINGS.

properties.NAME: CORNWALL PUBLIC LIBRARY
properties.DESCRIPT: BUILT IN 1953 AND USED AS A POST OFFICE UNTIL 1995, THE RENOVATION/RESTORATION RESULTED IN A STATE-OF-THE ART REGIONAL LEVEL LIBRARY FACILITY.

properties.NAME: OLD BAPTIST CHURCH
properties.DESCRIPT: RESTING ON A ROUGH MASONRY FOUNDATION, THIS MODEST BRICK BUILDING WAS CONSTRUCTED IN THE GOTHIC STYLE WHICH WAS POPULAR IN NINETEENTH CENTURY ONTARIO.

properties.NAME: THE SMART/FRASER HOUSE
properties.DESCRIPT: J. F. SMART, DEPUTY SHERIFF OF CORNWALL, ERECTED THE BUILDING CIRCA 1883. THE PROPERTY WAS LATER OWNED BY CHARLES SARGENT, THE RESIDENT ENGINEER OF THE ST. LAWRENCE CANAL.

properties.NAME: PORT THEATRE
properties.DESCRIPT: OFFICIALLY OPENED DEC. 26, 1941 AS THE ROXY THEATRE, THE BUILDING WAS A STATE OF THE ART MOVIE THEATRE EMPLOYING THE LATEST CONSTRUCTION TECHNIQUES, AUDIO EQUIPMENT AND SAFETY FEATURES.

properties.NAME: FORMER NATIVITY SCHOOL
properties.DESCRIPT: THE ARCHITECTURAL FEATURES INCLUDES A FINE EXAMPLE OF INSTITUTIONAL EDWARDIAN CLASSICAL (1900-1930) STYLE, AND PROMINENT FRONT BRICK FAÇADE ON ORIGINAL PORTION OF THE SCHOOL.

properties.NAME: NATIVITY CHURCH
properties.DESCRIPT: THE FIRST MASS WAS CELEBRATED IN THE CHURCH ON CHRISTMAS DAY, 1891. IT WAS THE CHURCH OF THE FIRST FRENCH PARISH IN CORNWALL TO SERVE THE MANY FRENCH CANADIANS ATTRACTED TO THE CITY BY ITS BOOMING TEXTILE INDUSTRY.

properties.NAME: ST. COLUMBAN'S CHURCH
properties.DESCRIPT: FOUNDED IN 1829, ST. COLUMBAN'S CHURCH WAS THE FIRST ROMAN CATHOLIC CHURCH TO BE ESTABLISHED IN CORNWALL.

properties.NAME: CORNWALL GRAMMAR SCHOOL
properties.DESCRIPT: THIS DESIGNATED BUILDING IS CONSIDERED TO BE ONE OF THE BUILDINGS IN THE EVOLUTION OF HISTORIC CORNWALL COLLEGIATE AND VOCATIONAL SCHOOL. THE SCHOOL'S HISTORY DATES BACK TO 1803 AND IS CONSIDERED THE OLDEST CONTINUALLY OPERATED SCHOOL IN ONTARIO.

properties.NAME: THE CLINE HOUSE
properties.DESCRIPT: THIS TWO STOREY RESIDENCE WAS ERECTED IN THE LATE 1850S FOR SAMUEL CLINE, A PROSPEROUS AND PROMINENT CORNWALL MERCHANT AND BUSINESSMAN.
